data.message: I wish I could disable the "suggested pages" part of your site. I just got a page for a health/beauty page that had a fetish photograph, complete with nudity, on my home page. So glad my little kids weren't with me at the time. Who can I report this to? Also, I have tried messaging your page with a warning about a sexually explicit image sent by FB to a friend who had sent out too many messages. It was part of a security collage featuring cats. Ahem. Although amusing, it can be inappropriate in certain cases. Thanks.

replies.message: Thanks for letting us know, Susan. We'll share your feedback with the team. In the meantime, you can report that particular Page here: http://on.fb.me/1RHolqp. Additionally, you can learn about managing your ad preferences here: http://on.fb.me/1PNmVWz. -Anna

Facebook -- when I went to the Report screen, it hyperlinks to the Community Standards. But when I click on the hyperlink, it simply brings me back to the page. I have sent you the link in a private message just now. I don't think it is appropriate to share here.

Also, this was NOT an ad. It was a "suggested page" and only had an "x" on the photo. I clicked it thinking it would bring me to the "why am i seeing this" menu of options, but it simply closed the page image and popped up another page. Where is the setting for suggested pages??
Facebook. Please see my two new replies.
